results.snippet: VIRGINIA BEACH, Va. -- The Atlantic Ocean has given bountifully to Virginia Beach, although a few years ago the ocean came within a wave or two of taking it all away. But, with the erosion problem under control, at least for the moment, and despite a...

byline.original: By ROBERT PEARMAN

results.lead_paragraph: VIRGINIA BEACH, Va. -- The Atlantic Ocean has given bountifully to Virginia Beach, although a few years ago the ocean came within a wave or two of taking it all away. But, with the erosion problem under control, at least for the moment, and despite a slow start in an exceptionally cool May and June, this resort town expects to wind up the summer with a decidedly favorable balance sheet.

results.abstract: Mercury capsule manned by Capt V I Grissom launched 118 mi into space by Redstone rocket, makes 16-min suborbital flight, lands at sea 303 mi from Cape Canaveral launching site, sinks after unexpected blowing of escape hatch floods it; Grissom swims out, is picked up by helicopter; 2d helicopter forced to drop capsule into sea as flooding makes it too heavy to lift and plane's motor overheats; Grissom in good condition despite swallowing sea water; swam about 75 ft; claims he did not pull plunger controlling hatch's explosive bolts; films of Grissom's face and instrument panel lost with other equipment in capsule valued at $2 million but officials stress most data were radioed to ground during flight; capsule sinks in 2,800 fathoms, too deep for salvage; loss of capsule seen setback to program but operations dir Williams sees no over-all delay; Grissom developed slight sore throat, apparently from swallowing water, seemed a bit shaky when brought aboard carrier USSR Randolph, but soon relaxed; launching scene described; flight and recovery illus

headline.main: U.S. AGAIN FIRES MAN INTO SPACE; CAPSULE LOST AFTER SEA LANDING, BUT ASTRONAUT SWIMS TO SAFETY; HATCH BLOWN OFF Mishap Not Explained--Grissom Reported in Good Condition U. S. Fires Second Man Into Space; Capsule Lost, but Astronaut Swims to Safety GRISSOM IS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION Hatch Is Blown Off Craft in an Unexplained Mishap After 303-Mile Flight

results.snippet: THROUGHOUT history, societies have expressed their aspirations in monumental enterprises which, though not necessary for their survival, have taxed them to their physical and intellectual limits. History often views these monuments as symbolizing the...

byline.original: By ALVIN M. WEINBERG

results.lead_paragraph: THROUGHOUT history, societies have expressed their aspirations in monumental enterprises which, though not necessary for their survival, have taxed them to their physical and intellectual limits. History often views these monuments as symbolizing the societies. The pyramids symbolize Egypt, Europe's magnificent cathedrals symbolize the church culture of the Middle Ages, Versailles the France of Louis XIV, and so on.

headline.main: How to Be a Leader Without Leading; Mike Mansfield accomplishes it in the Senate, eschewing intrigue, threats and pressures. Senate Leader

results.snippet: WASHINGTON. MICHAEL J. MANSFIELD of Montana, leader of the Democratic majority in the United States Senate and a principal legislative engineer of President Kennedy's program in Congress, is a rare study in the phenomenon of leadership.

byline.original: By FREDERIC W. COLLINS

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON. MICHAEL J. MANSFIELD of Montana, leader of the Democratic majority in the United States Senate and a principal legislative engineer of President Kennedy's program in Congress, is a rare study in the phenomenon of leadership.

results.abstract: in Rio de Janeiro

headline.main: E.M. KENNEDY IN RIO; President's Brother to Meet Top Brazilians on Tour

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

results.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 30 -Edward M. Kennedy, President Kennedy's brother, was welcomed to Brazil today by John Moors Cabot, United States Ambassador.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 30 -Edward M. Kennedy, President Kennedy's brother, was welcomed to Brazil today by John Moors Cabot, United States Ambassador.

headline.main: NEIGHBORLY DUTY PUT TO CATHOLICS; Man and Woman Next Door' Stressed at St. Patrick's

results.snippet: Roman Catholics have "the same duty to the man and woman next door as the Pope has to the world," the Rev. Daniel P. Byrne of the New York Apostolate Mission Band said yesterday.
results.lead_paragraph: Roman Catholics have "the same duty to the man and woman next door as the Pope has to the world," the Rev. Daniel P. Byrne of the New York Apostolate Mission Band said yesterday.
